intro: Pedilanthus bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian candleplant, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
